programme.title: Close Proximity
programme.desc: After a win in Texas, Matt Field and his team head to Irwindale, Calif. with renewed hope and in high spirits.

programme.title: Close Proximity
programme.desc: After a weeklong break, Matt and his crew are refreshed and ready for their next stop in Montreal.

programme.title: Close Proximity
programme.desc: After a controversial call by the judges at the Formula Drift stop in Montreal, Matt Field focuses on restoring his mangled car for the next stop.

programme.title: Close Proximity
programme.desc: Professional drift car driver Matt Field takes a break from the Formula Drift Championship Series and heads to Japan to compete in the D1 Grand Prix.

programme.title: Close Proximity
programme.desc: After returning from China, Matt Field heads to Fallon, Nevada to compete in the Fallon 250-a 250-mile off-road race alongside his father Bruce Field.

programme.desc: Professional drift car driver Matt Field prepares for the next Formula Drift stop at Texas Motorway.

programme.title: Butterfly Effect
programme.desc: Early in their history, humans realize that they can affect nature by controlling fire, making tools and taming wild animals; what they were not given by nature, they harnessed in other species.

programme.title: Butterfly Effect
programme.sub-title: Gravity: It All Falls Into Place!
programme.desc: From the mysterious megaliths in prehistory to the first hot air balloons and the construction of the Giza pyramid complex, ancestors have always observed and experimented to gain a better understanding of their world.

programme.title: Butterfly Effect
programme.sub-title: Viruses and Bacteria: Tiny but Tough
programme.desc: A journey through the key events that have allowed people to better understand the world of microbe.

programme.title: Butterfly Effect
programme.desc: A journey through the key moments that enabled humanity to discover plastics.

programme.title: Butterfly Effect
programme.desc: Long-distance communication, moving stealthily through the dark without being detected, and observation from afar have all become commonplace; at any moment, one can know exactly where one is on the planet.

programme.title: Butterfly Effect
programme.desc: The understanding of energy enables people to send rockets into space; learning what exactly is energy and where it comes from.

programme.title: Butterfly Effect
programme.sub-title: Fluid Mechanics: A Source of Inspiration
programme.desc: Running climate simulations on a global scale; learning to control rivers and protect against flooding.

programme.title: Butterfly Effect
programme.sub-title: Quantum Physics: A Step Into Unknown
programme.desc: The development of incredible technologies, from the infinitely small to the infinitely large; a journey through the key moments that allow humanity to discover quantum physics.

programme.title: Butterfly Effect
programme.sub-title: Chaos Theory: Small Causes, Great Effects
programme.desc: Many natural phenomena are based on the laws of physics; forecasting the weather several days in advance; asking if it is possible to predict everything.

programme.title: Butterfly Effect
programme.desc: Countless machines are used to perform hard work in one's daily life, with each of them obeying a specific program custom-written in a particular language.

programme.title: Butterfly Effect
programme.sub-title: Mathematics: How to Speak to Robots?
programme.desc: Handling numbers so large that all the books in the world would not be enough to contain them; societies are profoundly reliant on an increasingly complex equation.

programme.title: Butterfly Effect
programme.desc: People just begin to understand what happens beneath their feet in the heart of the planet, to be better equipped to predict and prepare for tomorrow's volcanic eruptions or tsunamis.

programme.title: Proof of Concept
programme.desc: Comedian Maz Jobrani and Blackjack legend Mike Aponte play the odds, meanwhile, Dianna finds order in chaos, and just maybe hacks the stock market.
